message: I'm on 2.2 on my Droid Incredible right now

its like letting Apple contracting HTC to build the next iphone. Its just going to suck.
/me continues to rock the G1
I'd buy an android phone if apple made one
Also, I think there are plans to release honeycomb to non-tablets, but I think its further out.

My impressions of Honeycomb based on screens, the interview with Duarte, and the TC write-up of it (that @parislemon referred to), are that it's not really designed for people, so much as for engineers.

I really looked forward to the Notion Ink Adam.  I'm less excited about it now that I have a Kindle.  Who knows if it'll ever get Honeycomb...

Assuming that Honeycomb makes it to phones, I'd really like to see some better optimization to improve battery life. My Evo would only last about 6 hours with moderate use, and "Android System" was responsible for about 40% of that.

anyone buying the xoom soon?
Not for $800, I'm not.  I thought the whole point of running a "free" OS was to keep costs _down_ ?
same thing, quite dissapointed... I was hoping for something cheaper than the ipad
@thealanberman the hardware is amazing.  I know people want to compare it to the ipad, but the xoom's hardware far exceeds the ipad.

@zoidberg No matter how powerful and feature packed it is, it's still more of a "computer appliance" than a full computer. Tablet-style computing is still more of a novelty than a necessity -- and just isn't worth $800 to most people. Myself included.

@thealanberman I completely agree. I'm not going to drop that much money on something which has more limited functionality than a laptop... especially when I could get a laptop with far better hardware for much cheaper. These tablets need to have pricing on the level with a netbook.
@apfeljonas honeyginger sounds delicious. Seriously.
@justinlilly wards off the common cold, too.
